meanings.definition: Not requiring immediate attention or action.
meanings.sent1: The nonurgent task could wait until tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The nonurgent email was left unread for a few days.
meanings.sent3: The nonurgent request for more cookies made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her nonurgent pace in the race allowed others to pass her by.
meanings.sent5: The nonurgent nature of the sunset made it even more beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The nonurgent meeting was rescheduled multiple times.
meanings.sent2: His nonurgent tone indicated a lack of concern.
meanings.sent3: The nonurgent decision of what to wear led to a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The nonurgent book on the shelf gathered dust for years.
meanings.sent5: The nonurgent nature of the clouds made them seem peaceful and serene.
